source_audio.description: A breakdown of the types of audio sources in the dataset. Each label indicates whether it applies to the dataset, with supporting evidence from the paper.

Human Speech (Read).description: Audio is generated by humans reading scripted or prepared text.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of audio applies to the dataset. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper where this type of audio is described (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as human-read speech.

Human Speech (Conversation).description: Audio is sourced from natural human conversations, such as dialogues or discussions.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of audio applies to the dataset. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper where this type of audio is described (e.g., 'Section 3.3').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as conversational human speech.

Human Speech (Spontaneous).description: Audio consists of spontaneous human speech, not read from a script.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of audio applies to the dataset. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper where this type of audio is described (e.g., 'Section 4.1').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as spontaneous human speech.

Non-Human Sound.description: Audio is a recording of non-human natural sounds, such as animals, weather, or ambient environments.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of audio applies to the dataset. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper where this type of audio is described (e.g., 'Section 2.1').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as non-human sound.

Model-Generated.description: Audio is synthetically generated by AI models, e.g. TTS or model-generated effects.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of audio applies to the dataset. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper where model-generated audio is mentioned (e.g., 'Section 5.2').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as model-generated.

Unknown Origin.description: The source of the audio is unclear, unreported, or derived from unidentified or unattributed sources (e.g., large-scale web crawl).

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset includes audio of unclear or unspecified origin. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper indicating the information of the audio dataset (e.g., 'Appendix B').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for classifying audio as having unknown origin.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any audio data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset does not contain audio. If true, provide reference and reasoning.

reference.description: The location in the paper confirming there is no audio in the dataset (e.g., 'Section 1.1').

reasoning.description: Justification based on the paper content for why audio is not applicable to the dataset.
